definition: to hold/to contain/to ladle/to pick up with a utensil

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format

sentences.english: Poetry prophecy is an exotic flower in remote mountains which is in full bloom in our Chinese classics hundred-flower garden.
sentences.chinese: 詩讖是盛開在中國古典文學百花園裏的一株深山奇葩。

sentences.english: Both has the fertile soil fertile farmland, bumper grain harvest, and has the broad prairie, a hundred flowers in full bloom.
sentences.chinese: 既有沃土良田，五穀豐登，又有廣闊草原，百花盛開。

sentences.english: Lies are like flower in full bloom; they look beautiful but do not last long.
sentences.chinese: 謊話像盛開的鮮花，外表美麗，生命短暫。

sentences.english: In vernal breeze still smile pink peach blossoms full blown.
sentences.chinese: 在春風裏粉紅色的桃花依然笑着盛開。

sentences.english: Other factories have spread like wild flowers among what were once rice fields and fish farms.
sentences.chinese: 大量的廠房像野花一樣盛開在原來的稻田和漁場之上。

sentences.english: The peonies are in full bloom in the park. If you go to see them, I will accompany you.
sentences.chinese: 公園裏牡丹盛開，如果你去賞花，我願意陪你去。

sentences.english: All the time, he savoured the gillyflowers in full bloom under my windows.
sentences.chinese: 他一直聞着盛開在我窗下的紫羅蘭花香氣。

sentences.english: Nyingchi in spring. The land becomes a sea of blossoming rape plants.
sentences.chinese: 林芝的春天，油菜花盛開的田野。

sentences.english: Rain of the bosom flowers fall into the dry land of my admiring heart.
sentences.chinese: 盛開的花雨落在我充滿渴望的心那乾涸的土地上。

sentences.english: A cloth had been spread over a little round table on which was a vase of fragrant plum blossom.
sentences.chinese: 小圓桌鋪上了檯布，添了瓶盛開的臘梅，吐着幽香。

sentences.english: A hundred bright yellow flowers grow.
sentences.chinese: 現在盛開着鮮豔奪目的一片小黃花。

sentences.english: The bleak breeze blights the brightly blooming blossom.
sentences.chinese: 陰冷的風摧殘着燦爛的正在盛開的花朵。

sentences.english: But can memories bloom in a desert like this?
sentences.chinese: 但是記憶之花能在這般荒漠中盛開嗎？

sentences.english: All the time, you are the lotus in full bloom in the charming Jiangnan.
sentences.chinese: 一直以來，你都是蓮，盛開在迷人的江南。

sentences.english: The apple Tree Branch sympathized and looked at the little flowers blooming next to the fields and streams.
sentences.chinese: 蘋果樹枝同情的看着那些在地頭溪邊盛開的小花。

definition: to bloom/to blossom/to flower/fig. to burst open/to feel happy or elated/new development grows out
oriental cherry (Prunus serrulata or Prunus yedoensis), prized for its blossom/also known as sakura (Japanese) or Yoshino cherry
lotus flower (Nelumbo nucifera Gaertn, among others)/water-lily
style of folk song popular in Gansu, Qinghai and Ningxia/CL:首[shou3]
tender and beautiful/also written 嬌艷|娇艳
